set.name: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

card.name: Allied Strategies
card.ability: Domain — Target player draws a card for each basic land type among lands he or she controls.
card.flavor: Each commander looked at the others and wondered who would be first to break the alliance.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You draw one card per basic land type, not for each basic land. This makes it a maximum of 5 cards.
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Armadillo Cloak
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: "Don't laugh. It works."

card.name: Bone Shredder
card.ability:
Flying
Echo {2}{B} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Bone Shredder enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.

card.name: Carrion Feeder
card.ability:
Carrion Feeder can't block.
Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Carrion Feeder.
card.flavor: Stinking of rot, it leaps between gravestones in search of its next meal.

card.name: Charging Troll
card.ability:
Vigilance
{G}: Regenerate Charging Troll.
card.flavor: They stop for nothing, not even the end of a battle.

card.name: Coalition Relic
card.ability:
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{T}: Put a charge counter on Coalition Relic.
At the beginning of your precombat main phase, remove all charge counters from Coalition Relic. Add one mana of any color to your mana pool for each charge counter removed this way.
card.ruling:
5/1/2007 : If you remove multiple charge counters from Coalition Relic at once, you may add a different color of mana to your mana pool for each one.
5/1/2007 : Only the first main phase each turn is considered a precombat main phase, even if other combat phases are created (with Relentless Assault, for example).

card.name: Darigaaz, the Igniter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Darigaaz, the Igniter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals his or her hand and Darigaaz deals damage to the player equal to the number of cards of that color revealed this way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

card.name: Darigaaz's Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand; or Darigaaz's Charm deals 3 damage to target creature or player; or target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Dark Ritual
card.ability: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"From void evolved Phyrexia. Great Yawgmoth, Father of Machines, saw its perfection. Thus the Grand Evolution began."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

card.name: Elfhame Palace
card.ability:
Elfhame Palace enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Llanowar has seven elfhames, or kingdoms, each with its own ruler. Their palaces are objects of awe, wonder, and envy.

card.name: Evasive Action
card.ability: Domain — Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor: Effective use of terrain is a lesson good commanders learn quickly.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Exotic Curse
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Domain — Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor:
Fouler than a necromancer's kiss.
—Jamuraan expression
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Fertile Ground
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.flavor: As Phyrexians descended, Multani paused to reflect on the beauty that might never be seen again.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The color of mana to be generated is chosen when tapping the land for mana.

card.name: Gerrard Capashen
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 1 life for each card in target opponent's hand.
{3}{W}: Tap target creature. Activate this ability only if Gerrard Capashen is attacking.

card.name: Gerrard's Command
card.ability: Untap target creature. It gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Unless you like the idea of becoming some goblin's lunch, get up and move!"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This can target a creature which is already untapped.

card.name: Harrow
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Harrow, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: No spot in nature is truly barren.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can't pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
10/4/2004 : The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Hideous End
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. Its controller loses 2 life.
card.flavor: Death is a generous author, always willing to grant a stirring final chapter.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Hideous End resolves, the entire spell is countered. No one loses life.

card.name: Hornet Cannon
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying and haste named Hornet onto the battlefield. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Lightning Greaves
card.ability:
Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {0}
card.flavor: After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : You are not allowed to "unequip" equipment from a creature. If Lightning Greaves is attached to the only creature you control, you won't be able to attach other equipment to it (or target it with anything else) until you have another creature onto which you can move Lightning Greaves.

card.name: Living Death
card.ability: Each player exiles all creature cards from his or her graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures he or she controls, then puts all cards he or she exiled this way onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The creatures which are sacrificed can't be regenerated.
10/4/2004 : If two of the same Legendary permanent enter the battlefield, both will be put into the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : Both players exile their creature cards at once. Then both players sacrifice all creatures they control at once. Then both players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield. If there are any choices involved for a given step, the current player makes their choices first, then the other player, and finally you do the action all at once.

card.name: Narrow Escape
card.ability: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand. You gain 4 life.
card.flavor: He could find no strength left to budge, no power left to fight, no will left to live. Luckily, they could find him.

card.name: Nomadic Elf
card.ability: {1}{G}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "I've journeyed across Dominaria. Phyrexians are everywhere. Plague is everywhere. There's no place left to hide."

card.name: Order of Yawgmoth
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Order of Yawgmoth deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

card.name: Phyrexian Arena
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
card.flavor: An audience of one with the malice of thousands.

card.name: Phyrexian Battleflies
card.ability:
Flying
{B}: Phyrexian Battleflies gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
card.flavor: After encountering them, Squee finally lost his appetite for bugs.

card.name: Phyrexian Broodlings
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Phyrexian Broodlings.
card.flavor: With limited resources and near unlimited time, Kerrick used parts from one beast to build another.

card.name: Phyrexian Colossus
card.ability:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

card.name: Phyrexian Debaser
card.ability:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Debaser: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The second stage of the illness: high fever and severe infectiousness."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Phyrexian Defiler
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Defiler: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The third stage of the illness: muscle aches and persistent cough."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Phyrexian Denouncer
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Denouncer: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The first stage of the illness: rash and nausea."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Phyrexian Gargantua
card.ability: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
card.flavor: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.

card.name: Phyrexian Ghoul
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Phyrexian Ghoul gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Phyrexia wastes nothing. Its food chain is a spiraling cycle.

card.name: Phyrexian Hulk
card.flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

card.name: Phyrexian Negator
card.ability:
Trample
Whenever Phyrexian Negator is dealt damage, sacrifice that many permanents.
card.flavor: They exist to cease.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Sacrificing this card does not prevent you from having to make the other sacrifices.

card.name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Plaguelord: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The final stage of the illness: delirium, convulsions, and death."
—Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Phyrexian Processor
card.ability:
As Phyrexian Processor enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life.
{4}, {T}: Put an X/X black Minion creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the life paid as Phyrexian Processor entered the battlefield.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can pay 0 life if you want, but it's not useful most of the time.

card.name: Phyrexian Totem
card.ability:
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{2}{B}: Phyrexian Totem becomes a 5/5 black Horror artifact creature with trample until end of turn.
Whenever Phyrexian Totem is dealt damage, if it's a creature, sacrifice that many permanents.
card.ruling:
9/25/2006 : When damage is dealt to Phyrexian Totem, its triggered ability will trigger. A number of permanents equal to the amount of damage dealt will be sacrificed when the ability resolves. It doesn't matter if Phyrexian Totem isn't on the battlefield when the ability resolves, as long as Phyrexian Totem was a creature as it left the battlefield. If one of the permanents sacrificed is Phyrexian Totem itself, the requisite number of other permanents must still be sacrificed.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Phyrexian Vault
card.ability: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew."
—Kaervek

card.name: Power Armor
card.ability: Domain — {3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor:
"Great peril demands formidable weaponry."
—Urza
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Priest of Gix
card.ability: When Priest of Gix enters the battlefield, add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Gix doesn't want a people to rule but puppets to entertain his madness."
—Xantcha, Phyrexian outcast
card.ruling: 1/25/2011 : You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

card.name: Puppet Strings
card.ability: {2}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor: "Have no illusions," Volrath warned Greven, "about free will."

card.name: Quirion Elves
card.ability:
As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

card.name: Rith, the Awakener
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Rith, the Awakener deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, choose a color, then put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each permanent of that color.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

card.name: Rith's Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Destroy target nonbasic land; or put three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield; or prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

card.name: Sanguine Guard
card.ability:
First strike
{1}{B}: Regenerate Sanguine Guard.
card.flavor:
"Father of Machines! Your filigree gaze carves us, and the scars dance upon our grateful flesh."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

card.name: Shivan Oasis
card.ability:
Shivan Oasis enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Only the hardiest explorers survive to eat the fruit.

card.name: Slay
card.ability:
Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You don't draw a card if this spell is countered.

card.name: Sunscape Battlemage
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{G} and/or {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} and/or {2}{U} as you cast this spell.)
When Sunscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{G} kicker, destroy target creature with flying.
When Sunscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {2}{U} kicker, draw two cards.

card.name: Tendrils of Corruption
card.ability: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.
card.flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The amount of life you gain is equal to the number of Swamps you control, not the amount of damage Tendrils of Corruption deals (in case some of it is prevented).
10/1/2009 : If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Tendrils of Corruption would resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won't gain any life.

card.name: Terramorphic Expanse
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Thornscape Apprentice
card.ability:
{R}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

card.name: Thornscape Battlemage
card.ability:
Kicker {R} and/or {W} (You may pay an additional {R} and/or {W} as you cast this spell.)
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {R} kicker, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When Thornscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {W} kicker, destroy target artifact.

card.name: Thunderscape Battlemage
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{B} and/or {G} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} and/or {G} as you cast this spell.)
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, target player discards two cards.
When Thunderscape Battlemage enters the battlefield, if it was kicked with its {G} kicker, destroy target enchantment.

card.name: Treva, the Renewer
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Treva, the Renewer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, choose a color, then you gain 1 life for each permanent of that color.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

card.name: Treva's Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Destroy target enchantment; or exile target attacking creature; or draw a card, then discard a card.

card.name: Tribal Flames
card.ability: Domain — Tribal Flames deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
card.flavor:
"Fire is the universal language."
—Jhoira, master artificer
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Urza's Rage
card.ability:
Kicker {8}{R} (You may pay an additional {8}{R} as you cast this spell.)
Urza's Rage can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Urza's Rage deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If Urza's Rage was kicked, instead it deals 10 damage to that creature or player and the damage can't be prevented.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This spell has a self-replacement in it . This means that if Urza's Rage is kicked, the 3 damage is replaced with 10 unpreventable damage before any other replacements can be applied. For example, you can't use Healing Salve to prevent the 3 damage before it gets changed.
10/4/2004 : You can target this spell with spells and abilities, so you can change its target. Those spells and abilities just can't counter it.
10/4/2004 : The damage is unpreventable, but it can be affected by replacement effects.
10/4/2004 : It can be countered by game rules, such as by having all its targets be illegal. Game rules are neither spells or abilities.
10/4/2004 : Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

card.name: Verduran Emissary
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Verduran Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Voltaic Key
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Untap target artifact.
card.flavor: The key did not work on a single lock, yet it opened many doors.

card.name: Whispersilk Cloak
card.ability:
Equipped creature is unblockable and has shroud.
Equip {2}
card.flavor: Such cloaks are in high demand both by assassins and by those who fear them.

card.name: Worn Powerstone
card.ability:
Worn Powerstone enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Even a fragment of a powerstone contains within it not just energy, but space—vast dimensions trapped in fragile crystal.

card.name: Yavimaya Elder
card.ability:
When Yavimaya Elder dies, you may search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}, Sacrifice Yavimaya Elder: Draw a card.
